snippet: In remarks at a workshop, a judge who served on the secret Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court said the country needed a more open debate on surveillance.
abstract: James Robertson, retired federal judge who served on Secret Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court, praises growing public discussion about government surveillance fostered by leaks of classified information by Edward J Snowden, former National Security Agency contractor.
lead_paragraph: In remarks at a workshop, a judge who served on the secret Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court said the country needed a more open debate on surveillance.

headline.main: Nation Will Gain by Discussing Surveillance, Expert Tells Privacy Board
headline.print_headline: Nation Will Gain by Discussing Surveillance, Expert Tells Privacy Board

keywords.value: Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board
keywords.name: organizations
